sub_title: PhD Scholar | Member SSSI, Australia | Fellow RGS, UK | GiS Manager | Consultant | Licensed SS, SOP, Pakistan | NUST |
summary: I am specialized, experienced, result oriented and highly motivated professional having more than 13 years of work experience in Geographical Information Sciences (GIS), Hydrology, Cartography, Geo-database and Remote Sensing. I have in- depth knowledge of geospatial application in natural resources management, infrastructure planning, social sector services, decision support system, web mapping, utility management, land Information system and cadastral mapping gained through MSc and MS Remote sensing & GIS education and professional training. I am PG member of Royal Geographic Society, London

awards.title: Fellow of Royal Geographic Society, London
awards.description: The Royal Geographical Society (with the Institute of British Geographers) is the UK's learned society and professional body for geography, founded in 1830. We are a world leader in advancing geography and supporting its practitioners in the UK and across the world. RSG-IBG has awarded PG Fellow membership in 2015 and upgraded it to FELLOW membership status in 2018

projects.title: Designing and implementing Digital Cadastre Database (DCDB) for Pakistan
projects.description: Land information management is cumbersome but is very much feasible at national level. Models are available internationally and can be consulted and followed in order to completely transform our land management system. With few modification international models can be well implemented in Pakistan. Digitization of Cadastre system, being the basic unit of LIS, is key step in developing digital Land Administration System. It will help in effectively managing many organizations in Pakistan working on different aspects of land information and administration including Survey of Pakistan (SoP), Federal and Provincial Board of Revenue (BoR), Development Authorities, Housing Authorities, Tehsil and Town administration, Excise and taxation departments.

projects.title: DELINEATION  OF HYDROLOGIC UNIT CODES (HUC) OF SOAN BASIN
projects.description: Delineation of watershed is basic constituent of water management. With the help of watershed, estimation and management of water resources at country level is an internationally adopted technique. Furthermore classification of watershed from continental to regional and local level provided ease in management of hydrological resources. In the hour of need, like flood and drought conditions, water management can be provided to very basic level. We recommend above delineated classification to be done from country to provincial and localized levels to help maintain our precious water resources for natural hazard management to irrigation maintenance. Soan is the 2nd level watershed after the Indus basin which is considered as the 1st level watershed in Pakistan. The coding for the first level is (Regional level) 00 and for the second level is (Sub Regional) 0000 and for the third level 000000 as per USGS standard hydrologic unit coding (HUC) system. Soan watershed is sub-regional watershed in Pakistan

projects.title: Spatio-Temporal Variation Of Land Surface Temperature Along The  Karachi Coast To Inland Areas
projects.description:
RS-based LST can be determined from “atmospheric windows”. An atmospheric window is microwave or infrared in its behavior through thermal emission. LST uncertainties involved in the retrieval of radiance which is less than (1-2K) than those of microwave. Due to this fact there are minor range of change of surface radiance in the TIR realm. It is also dependant on the temperature. The  angle of surface ejection in the microwave is much larger and relies on the temperature which ultimately results in LST uncertainties. Calculations in infrared spectrum are susceptible to cloud contamination than that of microwaves. The finding of Strict cloud detection can reduce the uncertainty to 2-3K, also the lasting cloud belongings to the microwave determinations are similar. The Infrared properties gets limited due to the presence of heavy presence. The “sunny day” partiality of IR results is noteworthy and differ temporally and spatially during the season. The relation of temperature variations and cloudiness in weather events give the overall variations. Calculation of microwave is limited in scope and less reliable due to large changes in emissivity of surface materials 
It is well know phenomena in RS that the land surface temperatures are very much related to the land and atmosphere  connection and energy flux. upward radiation flux causes surface energy balance and, latent and sensible heat loss fluxes. LST is dependent on the revisit which is influenced by sensor uniqueness, atmospheric situation, spectral emissivity, surface type variation, content in soil moisture, visual geometry. The average LST variation shows that as we move away from the coastal area temperature start rising

projects.title: SPATIO-TEMPORAL ANALYSIS OF WATER TABLE WITHIN RAWALPINDI MUNICIPAL JURISDICTION
projects.description: Groundwater is one of the most important freshwater resource necessary for Nation’s sustainability. Its uses range from household to industries spanning every sector of economy and has become a resource with strategic importance. Level of groundwater is dependent among various factors such as topography, aquifer type, climate etc. Over extraction of groundwater can lead to its depletion and result in problems like structural damage, salt water intrusion. Hence groundwater monitoring is important for groundwater management. In this respect, GIS has emerged as a very helpful toolin this regard as a tool for spatial analysis and mapping. In this study, spatio-temporal analysis of water table of Rawalpindi municipal jurisdiction has been done. The surfaces for surface elevation and water table of 1998, 2003 and 2007 were generated by IDW interpolation technique. Then vertical profiling was done and 9 cross sections were identified based on which spatial and temporal trends were identified. In addition, stratigraphy was also analysed by data of well logs. The main results of study showed that eastern side of Murree road has  enerally good situation of water levels but have faster depletion rates. The water table elevations are also decreasing gradually with increase in concentration of wells and discharge rates.
